revised_title: Crystal and Molecular Structure of Tetrachloro-Diphenylcalicene
tldr: The authors conducted an X-ray structure analysis of 1,2,3,4-tetrachloro-5,6-diphenylcalicene and found it to be a polyolefin. The crystal structure revealed significant bond alternation, which contradicts the idea of aromaticity in the calicene system. The study provides insights into the molecular and crystal structure of this compound, contributing to the understanding of its properties and reactivity.
